G. The disorder can only be inherited from the mother.

H. Neither of the parents can pass the disorder to their children

I. The children are anemic but show no symptoms due to a modifier gene.

J. Each child will inherit the disorder, but it will remain dormant until adulthood.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>

But in this case, since both parents have the mutation (either Bb or bb?), wait, the question states that Mr. Brown has a substitution in the beta-chain, which is one amino acid change, making him hemoglobin B, as he's hemoglobin B. Similarly, Mrs. Brown has a substitution in the alpha-chain, making her hemoglobin A. So each has one normal allele and one mutant allele, making them heterozygous (Bb). Thus, their children would be Bb (if they get one from each parent), who are carriers but not affected. So the correct answer should relate to both parents being carriers. Hence, option D seems correct.

Answer this question step by step with only a single letter. Problem: Both Mr. and Mrs. Brown suffer from anautosomalrecessive condition that makes them anemic. Mr. Brown has one amino acid substitution in the \beta-chain of his hemoglobin molecules and Mrs. Brown has a similar defect in her \alpha-chain. Neither Betsy norBoopsy, their children, are anemic. Explain.

A. Only one parent can pass the disorder to the children

B. Both parents will definitely pass the disorder to their children

C. Both children inherited a different form of anemia that is not detectable at their current age.

D. Both parents have a homozygous trait but may or may not pass the disorder to their children

E. The children cannot be carriers since they are not anemic.

F. The children have a 50% chance of being carriers and a 25% chance of being affected.

G. The disorder can only be inherited from the mother.

H. Neither of the parents can pass the disorder to their children

I. The children are anemic but show no symptoms due to a modifier gene.

J. Each child will inherit the disorder, but it will remain dormant until adulthood.

Answer with only a single letter. Answer:<|im_end|>
